reviews.text: Definitely one of the best Italian restaurant i have been.  I will be returning when I visit again server  Anna S was amazing we also meet one of the owner really nice.  Highly recommend!
Food was delicious. Don‚Äôt miss the chance to eat at this restaurant Sarah our server was outstanding very attentive and knowledgeable the menu.  Plus she was ‚ÄúHot‚Äù.

Sad we did not find this place sooner! First, our server, Enzo, was incredible! He asked to walk us through the new items on the menu and other options. He was very friendly and made the dining experience very comfortable. As out-of-towners it is often hard to find places that take good care of thier guests. Enzo surpassed my expectations. Second, the food was amazing! Flavorful and fresh. I had the scallops and shrimp in lemon sauce and was not disapponted! Actually could have had a few more pieces of the bread to soak up the sauce! l'ho adorato!

Great place.  It was our first visit.  Nice place, easy to find with plenty of parking.  Atmosphere was nice.  They sat us down right away and had our drinks on the table pretty quickly (this is a big plus for me), then gave us all the time we needed.  Nice menu with several specials.  I was happy to see the menu had some nice dishes that stood out from the bar like food you find all over Myrtle Beach.  I had a very tasty seafood meal.  The dessert was pretty standard, nothing all that special but good.  The waiter was very good.  He knew everything on the menu and was even able to state many of the ingredients and how it was cooked.  He was always there when we needed him and he never rushed us.  The price is a bit higher than the average for Myrtle Beach but the food is also equally better than the average.  You‚Äôve heard it before, you get what you pay for.  I did enjoy myself at Gios and will be returning.

I usually don‚Äôt like writing negative reviews, but my experience at Gio Italian Restaurant was disappointing to the point where I felt compelled to share.
My party and I arrived at the restaurant, and while it wasn‚Äôt particularly busy, we were seated promptly. Unfortunately, that's where the positive aspects of our visit ended. After being seated, we were completely ignored by the waitstaff for over 30 minutes. We could see other tables that had arrived after us receiving attention and service, but we were left sitting there, wondering if anyone would even acknowledge us.
After waiting and trying to get someone's attention, we realized that it wasn‚Äôt just a small mistake. The service was just absent. There was no explanation, no apology, nothing. Eventually, we decided to leave because, at that point, we had lost our patience. We didn't even get the chance to order anything, which was a huge disappointment because we were genuinely looking forward to trying their Italian dishes.
The restaurant wasn't busy, and we could clearly see that tables around us were getting served, so it wasn‚Äôt a staffing issue. It felt like we were being completely disregarded, and that's just unacceptable in any dining experience.
I won‚Äôt be returning anytime soon, and I would definitely suggest looking elsewhere for a better dining experience. Poor service can really ruin an otherwise great opportunity, and unfortunately, Gio Italian Restaurant missed the mark entirely

Edit as it will not let me respond.
We did let someone know‚Ä¶.. she went to the hostess stand where they talked for about 3 minutes to the other hostess. None of that staff moved to get a manager. It was at that point we decided to leave. I would be more than happy to reach out to the owner manager about this. But was afraid I would be ignored like I was in your restaurant. As far as my other reviews. I am fully aware of my ‚Äúother‚Äù reviews as I really only feel compelled to write them after horrible experiences. Which lucky for you I got one there.

recentReviews.text: We loved this place. Our last night in Myrtle Beach and we chose this restaurant out of 4 Italian restaurants and was so pleased. Food excellent and service. All was great. Thank you!!
Great food and nice servers and hosts! The lobster ravioli was so good and the lavender martini to die for

This Italian restaurant is hands down my favorite spot in town! The atmosphere is cozy and welcoming, and the staff always makes you feel like family. My go-to dish is Renato‚Äôs Favorite ‚Äî the flavors are absolutely incredible, and it‚Äôs clear that every ingredient is chosen with care. Pair it with one of their amazing wines, and it‚Äôs a perfect meal every time. If you‚Äôre looking for authentic Italian food and a dining experience that feels special, this is the place to go!

Have had the pleasure of eating a Gios‚Äôs on several occasions. Every meal has been excellent. The staff is always friendly and courteous. Never a problem with service. In some ways, I hate to recommend the restaurant because now we‚Äôll always have a harder time getting a table, but it is worth the wait.
Our favorite place in myrtle beach. never disappointed and always amazed at the service and quality of the meals served there

detailedReviews.author: Diana Westhoff
detailedReviews.text: We loved this place. Our last night in Myrtle Beach and we chose this restaurant out of 4 Italian restaurants and was so pleased. Food excellent and service. All was great. Thank you!!

detailedReviews.author: John Hollenbaugh
detailedReviews.text: Great good and atmosphere

detailedReviews.author: Angel Miller
detailedReviews.text: Great food and nice servers and hosts! The lobster ravioli was so good and the lavender martini to die for

detailedReviews.author: solange cheng
detailedReviews.text: This Italian restaurant is hands down my favorite spot in town! The atmosphere is cozy and welcoming, and the staff always makes you feel like family. My go-to dish is Renato‚Äôs Favorite ‚Äî the flavors are absolutely incredible, and it‚Äôs clear that every ingredient is chosen with care. Pair it with one of their amazing wines, and it‚Äôs a perfect meal every time. If you‚Äôre looking for authentic Italian food and a dining experience that feels special, this is the place to go!

detailedReviews.author: Debbie Sweezy
detailedReviews.text: Have had the pleasure of eating a Gios‚Äôs on several occasions. Every meal has been excellent. The staff is always friendly and courteous. Never a problem with service. In some ways, I hate to recommend the restaurant because now we‚Äôll always have a harder time getting a table, but it is worth the wait.

detailedReviews.author: America 1st1776
detailedReviews.text: Our favorite place in myrtle beach. never disappointed and always amazed at the service and quality of the meals served there

detailedReviews.author: Tom D
detailedReviews.text:
Stopped in during the supper time slam so the place was busy. I was still seated right away. Service was great. Went through every part of of the ordering process and upselling/ suggesting along the way.

Pre-appetizer came immediately after and my salad shortly after that. My appetizer had gotten forgotten but my server kept me updated a couple of times on its progress. I ended up getting it just before my main course. The meatball gios, the special salad dressing, chicken scarpiello...all bravissimo.

Worth a repeat visit sometime during my next MB visit.

detailedReviews.author: Rebecca H
detailedReviews.text: Had an amazing dinner at Gios. The Chicken Modena and Chicken Parmsian were excellent.

detailedReviews.author: Captain A
detailedReviews.text: First visit and it won't be the last. The food was wonderful, and was matched by the service. A truly memorable evening - thank you to all the staff, from our server (Chris, I think) to the back room boys and girls who all work really hard.

detailedReviews.author: Sam D
detailedReviews.text: Always fantastic food. Staff is hit or miss. Sometimes friendly and sometimes not. The hostess crew is not that welcoming.

detailedReviews.author: Christy T.
detailedReviews.text:
Gio‚Äôs was our first dinner on day one of our vacay. The atmosphere and interior is very nice and trendy, the service was on point , waitress knowledgeable and timely, and the food was enjoyed by all. The portions are large, so you‚Äôll likely be taking some home for another meal. We definitely will go again when we visit in the future. When you are craving that heavy, full feeling of eating a hearty Italian meal, this hits the mark.
We enjoyed the Alfredo, Chicken Marsala, Renato‚Äôs Favorite, Vodka Penne, Seafood pasta, and more.

detailedReviews.author: Christina Condos
detailedReviews.text: All was great!

detailedReviews.author: Jose Mangual
detailedReviews.text: Definitely one of the best Italian restaurant i have been.  I will be returning when I visit again server  Anna S was amazing we also meet one of the owner really nice.  Highly recommend!

detailedReviews.author: Bud Barrow
detailedReviews.text: Wonderful Italian restaurant.  Terrific experience.

detailedReviews.author: Ron Peeples Jr
detailedReviews.text: As a local, not our first time at Gios. At one point I thought this could be some of the best Italian in the area. Sadly, I‚Äôm not sure what happened however something has changed or is headed in the wrong direction. To set the stage, my wife and I sat at the bar around 7pm with only one other patron at the bar and I would say the restaurant was at 50% occupancy at best. It took at least 10 minutes for the bar tender to recognize us. Once recognized some waters were brought over. It took another 10-15 minutes for us to order a drink only after gently reminding the bar tender. Once our food order was placed, the service time was within expectation. Now for the food, and again I thought Gios had some of the best Italian in MB. We ordered the Mediterranean Veal and I the Meatballs and Sausage.  I will speak to the basics of my meal, the sausage and meatballs. The pasta was overcooked and the meatballs were soggy while the sausage overly blackened and squishy. Not what I expected and hopefully this was just a one off experience for the subpar service at the bar and quality of their food. I‚Äôd love to go back and support the restaurant but not at the expense of this recent experience. Hope they can figure out the weak link. I hesitated to write this review but perhaps it won‚Äôt fall on deaf ears.

detailedReviews.author: Ds Mommy
detailedReviews.text:
Our server, ROSE, made the night. She is fantastic!!!! The food is amazing as well, don‚Äôt get me wrong, but Rose made a night that was spiraling a great experience.

Three of the five of us got the penne alla vodka and it was so creamy and delicious. We took leftovers home, that typically end up in the trash, but you best believe not this time!  My 6yo loved the fettuccine alfredo. My husband said the chicken Marsala was very tender and yummy.

The ONLY downside was the hostess. Classic case of ‚Äúthe child doesn‚Äôt count as a full body‚Äù and she wanted to wedge four grown adults and a child in a booth. A note to the hostess, children actually take up more space than an average person because they wiggle‚Ä¶a lot!  Parents want to be comfortable and enjoy their meal, especially when they‚Äôre on vacation and not having to be the one to tend to people for once. And yes, we complained until she FINALLY got the hint and relocated us. If I‚Äôm spending over $100 on dinner I better be comfortable. It would‚Äôve been a whole different story had the place been busy, but it absolutely was not.

detailedReviews.author: Brian W
detailedReviews.text: Sad we did not find this place sooner! First, our server, Enzo, was incredible! He asked to walk us through the new items on the menu and other options. He was very friendly and made the dining experience very comfortable. As out-of-towners it is often hard to find places that take good care of thier guests. Enzo surpassed my expectations. Second, the food was amazing! Flavorful and fresh. I had the scallops and shrimp in lemon sauce and was not disapponted! Actually could have had a few more pieces of the bread to soak up the sauce! l'ho adorato!

detailedReviews.author: juliona bacalles
detailedReviews.text: Rose was the best waitress ever! So kind and sweet. Highly recommend and ask for Rose!

detailedReviews.author: Greg Morris
detailedReviews.text:
Had dinner at the bar. Great drinks!
Food and service were exceptional..

detailedReviews.author: Krab Lips
detailedReviews.text: Great place.  It was our first visit.  Nice place, easy to find with plenty of parking.  Atmosphere was nice.  They sat us down right away and had our drinks on the table pretty quickly (this is a big plus for me), then gave us all the time we needed.  Nice menu with several specials.  I was happy to see the menu had some nice dishes that stood out from the bar like food you find all over Myrtle Beach.  I had a very tasty seafood meal.  The dessert was pretty standard, nothing all that special but good.  The waiter was very good.  He knew everything on the menu and was even able to state many of the ingredients and how it was cooked.  He was always there when we needed him and he never rushed us.  The price is a bit higher than the average for Myrtle Beach but the food is also equally better than the average.  You‚Äôve heard it before, you get what you pay for.  I did enjoy myself at Gios and will be returning.

detailedReviews.author: Maria G
detailedReviews.text: On a recent visit, we were charged over 11.5% tax on our bill, plus an additional tax for our alcoholic drinks. The next night, we visited another restaurant, paid 8.6% tax and were NOT charged an additional tax for alcoholic drinks!! WTH, Gio's!! Food was good, drinks were very expensive, and we won't be returning.

detailedReviews.author: Chuck Boyle
detailedReviews.text: Pricey

detailedReviews.author: Jack Snack
detailedReviews.text:
This is my first negative review I have ever written for Google. I feel compelled to warn others.  Our first signal should've been that on a Friday night in Myrtle Beach at 6 o'clock and the restaurant was more than half empty.
We both ordered the special, it was a seafood Fra Diavolo. $40. Probably 10 bites of linguine, two shrimp, two small scallops, seven minute clams and the smallest lobster tail I've ever seen in my life! Two bites,
With all that being said, pasta is very inexpensive! It was doused in sauce, but no pasta???
And was so hot, it was almost inedible?
Just fair warning to all of that think they're going out for some good Italian food, I couldn't care less what the restaurant has to reply with. Shame on them. This is just an honest review of a restaurant knowingly, ripping people off . Do not waste your time.

detailedReviews.author: CJ
detailedReviews.text: Reminds me of food from my hometown. Which is hard to do. Awesome!

detailedReviews.author: Reagan Hendrix
detailedReviews.text: Gio‚Äôs never disappoints. The Pawleys Island location had an unexpected emergency, but luckily, we found out they had a second location. The food was just as incredible as always, and the service was outstanding. While I still prefer the atmosphere at the Pawleys spot‚Äîprobably because of the memories tied to it‚ÄîI was genuinely impressed that the quality and experience carried over seamlessly. I can‚Äôt say enough good things. Thank you, Gio‚Äôs‚Äînever lose what makes you so special!

detailedReviews.author: Samantha Sozio
detailedReviews.text: The pizza here was so good! My husband got the prosciutto & arugula pizza and I got the french connection. We started with 2 perfect margaritas that were very big and very good! I finished off with an espresso martini that was not very good at all - but besides that everything was great. We will be back!

detailedReviews.author: Olena Povtoreiko
detailedReviews.text: It was very delicious, but we had to wait a bit for the food. Still, this is the best Italian cuisine I‚Äôve had in Americaüòç

detailedReviews.author: derrick shields
detailedReviews.text:
I usually don‚Äôt like writing negative reviews, but my experience at Gio Italian Restaurant was disappointing to the point where I felt compelled to share.
My party and I arrived at the restaurant, and while it wasn‚Äôt particularly busy, we were seated promptly. Unfortunately, that's where the positive aspects of our visit ended. After being seated, we were completely ignored by the waitstaff for over 30 minutes. We could see other tables that had arrived after us receiving attention and service, but we were left sitting there, wondering if anyone would even acknowledge us.
After waiting and trying to get someone's attention, we realized that it wasn‚Äôt just a small mistake. The service was just absent. There was no explanation, no apology, nothing. Eventually, we decided to leave because, at that point, we had lost our patience. We didn't even get the chance to order anything, which was a huge disappointment because we were genuinely looking forward to trying their Italian dishes.
The restaurant wasn't busy, and we could clearly see that tables around us were getting served, so it wasn‚Äôt a staffing issue. It felt like we were being completely disregarded, and that's just unacceptable in any dining experience.
I won‚Äôt be returning anytime soon, and I would definitely suggest looking elsewhere for a better dining experience. Poor service can really ruin an otherwise great opportunity, and unfortunately, Gio Italian Restaurant missed the mark entirely

Edit as it will not let me respond.
We did let someone know‚Ä¶.. she went to the hostess stand where they talked for about 3 minutes to the other hostess. None of that staff moved to get a manager. It was at that point we decided to leave. I would be more than happy to reach out to the owner manager about this. But was afraid I would be ignored like I was in your restaurant. As far as my other reviews. I am fully aware of my ‚Äúother‚Äù reviews as I really only feel compelled to write them after horrible experiences. Which lucky for you I got one there.

detailedReviews.author: marius karlwich
detailedReviews.text: We enjoyed our dinner here. It's a beautiful restaurant but our food was a little lackluster. Chicken Alfredo just didn't have enough flavor. The chicken breast was also really white which just made it look unpalatable. It was tender though just kind of bland.

detailedReviews.author: Aubrey Kennedy
detailedReviews.text: Gio‚Äôs is the best place ever. The service and quality is phenomenal.

detailedReviews.author: Caroline Rocha
detailedReviews.text: We came here on our family vacation and had Anna as our server. She is so personable and made great food and drink recommendations. Everything was delicious from the salads, appetizers, and entrees. Best lobster ravioli and veal parm we have ever had !

detailedReviews.author: Kevin S
detailedReviews.text: Delicious lasagna and veal Bolognese. Tasty calamari.

detailedReviews.author: Lori Larrimore
detailedReviews.text:
Excellent good.
Excellent service by Rose!!
We will be back.

detailedReviews.author: MaKayla Wyatt
detailedReviews.text:
Hostess was very rude. After I was seated and ordered my drink the hostess came back up and asked for my friend to put on a shirt because she had a cute tank top on but it was sleeveless. The hostess could have told us that before we ordered our drinks. It‚Äôs like a glorified Olive Garden except Olive Garden is way better. EVERYONE LOOK AT THEIR REPLIES. Doesn‚Äôt seem very professional.

I see your guys reply are you stupid? I said a girl:)

detailedReviews.author: Justin G
detailedReviews.text: We come here every year for a vacation dinner,it will not disappoint! Food is phenomenal, fresh, and tasty! The staff and atmosphere is very nice and welcoming! Best Italian food on the east coast!

detailedReviews.author: Debra Jorgensen
detailedReviews.text: Over priced for the amount of food you get. My lettuce was brown on the edges, the bread was hard, and an ant was crawling on the table and onto my grandsons bread.

detailedReviews.author: Elizabeth Rose
detailedReviews.text: Staff were very rude. Sat us at a table after acting like they had no room for us because we didn‚Äôt have a reservation, the place was empty. Then after seating us they sent the hostess to tell us that my husband was dressed inappropriately because his shirt didn‚Äôt have sleeves (it‚Äôs 85 out) they wanted him to leave, change, then come back.

detailedReviews.author: Michael Smith
detailedReviews.text:
Ok so, the Chicken Mediterranean is amazing and would be the highlight of any other restaurant.  But, then you have the chicken picatta... It was mind blowingly good.  I love picatta but this was transcendent.

The service was great. The restaurant is tastefully decorated.

GET HERE FOR THE PICATTA.

detailedReviews.author: Michael Ames
detailedReviews.text: Staff was awesome, ordered a special and it was delicious. Great restaurant!

detailedReviews.author: suzanne k
detailedReviews.text: Excellent service and food! I have tried several italian restaurants in Myrtle Beach and have not been impressed in the least until this one. I discovered this place a  couple years ago and now make sure to visit when in town. This time I took the waitress/bartenders recommendation and ordered the Alfredo with chicken. Outstanding! (And I'm picky when it comes to Alfredo sauce). It's just right..not too thin and not too thick/creamy. Also, this literally had THREE chicken breasts. Several people walking by commented on how much food there was on plate. You will definitely not leave hungry. I've also had the lasagna in the past which is excellent also.

detailedReviews.author: Janet Hailey
detailedReviews.text: I came across this little gem by accident, and I am so glad I did.  Eggplant Parmigiana is one of my favorite dishes, but I'm usually disappointed when I order it. out. However, I decided to give it a try.  This was the best eggplant parmigiana ever!  The atmosphere and service were great.

detailedReviews.author: Adam Dolensky
detailedReviews.text: Everything was absolutely incredible. The service was fast, friendly, and knowledgeable. The food was flawless. I‚Äôd recommend it any day!

detailedReviews.author: David Miller
detailedReviews.text:
We had a great experience at Gios!
The food was excellent. The service was amazing. There were 5 of us, and we all loved our food. I had a NY strip steak. I asked for medium, and it was cooked perfectly all the way through.
The rest of them had a dish called chicken Mediterranean. Every bite was followed by a Mmmmmm.
Well done, Gios Italian Kitchen!!!

detailedReviews.author: TKH Nuyen
detailedReviews.text: Everything was so yummy

detailedReviews.author: ROLAND M
detailedReviews.text:
Delicious Italian food but the pasta portion was too small.
Left wanting more.
I had the Lemon veal piccata

detailedReviews.author: VooDoo Miss
detailedReviews.text:
Drinks were great and food was delicious. Wonderful service too.
We will definitely be back!

detailedReviews.author: Jennifer K show
detailedReviews.text: They are not  consistent with everyone with the dress code‚Ä¶. And when it was brought to the manager attention they were not very receptive of the feed back‚Ä¶ can‚Äôt tell someone to take something off but let someone else do it‚Ä¶.

detailedReviews.author: Lyrical Connections
detailedReviews.text:
I have had the worst food poisoning since eating here yesterday üò©
The waitress was great, but the food obviously isnt. Save your stomach a bad time.

detailedReviews.author: Jeremy Tubbs
detailedReviews.text: Food was true Italian cuisine

detailedReviews.author: Wade Hardin
detailedReviews.text: Always great food and service !

detailedReviews.author: Alex Moster
detailedReviews.text: They have Italian food

detailedReviews.author: Stephen Kennedy
detailedReviews.text: This was our second visit to Gio's, and we found this visit to be another excellent choice as we had another great meal with superior service. This restaurant consistently achieves a level of excellence in the preparation and presentation of their meals and menu items.  Their servers and other members of their team conduct themselves as customer service professionals. They are personable, friendly, and represent the restaurant as a quality dining experience.  We highly recommend this restaurant and look forward to our next visit.

detailedReviews.author: brittany haugen
detailedReviews.text:
I was there yesterday for Mother‚Äôs Day, with my boyfriend and his family. I was impressed with how delicious the food was, I ordered the burrata for an appetizer and the picatta with chicken for the entree. It hit the spot!
Our server, I forget his name, younger kid with dark curly hair, did a phenomenal job! He was informative, professional, pleasant, we enjoyed everything so much!
While we were sitting there at the table, we were reading the reviews, and we noticed that the owner really values their employees and takes up for them! We LOVED reading the responses that the owner had for some of the reviews.
We will definitely be back! ‚ò∫Ô∏è

detailedReviews.author: david bivens
detailedReviews.text: Wouldn‚Äôt have any idea what the food tastes like because we were never seated. Had a RESERVATION at 6:30 on Mothers Day and finally walked out at 7:30 after being told it would ‚Äújust be a minute‚Äù about every 10 minutes. I understand it‚Äôs a busy time but don‚Äôt accept the reservation if you can‚Äôt fulfill it. Waiting over an hour with a reservation is ridiculous. Won‚Äôt be returning.

detailedReviews.author: Steve Wheeler
detailedReviews.text: Our dinners were excellent. Our waitress, Sharon, was very attentive and fun to talk with.

detailedReviews.author: Sean Reynolds
detailedReviews.text: We had dinner at Gios and we could not have been more pleased.  Enizio was our waiter and was extremely knowlegable about the menu and his recommendations were right on point.  We spoke with the Manager to complement staff and the cook.  The Manager was awesome as well and told me that they are a family restaurant, and her husband is the cook.  Just amazing a must visit, we will be back again..

detailedReviews.author: Christina Lackey
detailedReviews.text: Can‚Äôt comment on the food because we decided not to stay after being told to remove a hat. I would understand this if we were in a fancy place- but for a $20 plate of pasta? I don‚Äôt think so. We eat in far better- and more expensive- locations regularly in the area, with a hat on. Gio‚Äôs is too big for their britches, and I‚Äôll spend my money at a place that makes more sense.

detailedReviews.author: Mark Conway
detailedReviews.text: I do not give 5 stars lightly! This place was that good. I had the shrimp, lobster and scallops with a spicy red sauce. It was amazing. The service was very good (Thank you Casey)  and the ambiance was nice. Well worth the price! You may need to make reservations. It was a Tuesday evening and it was full!

detailedReviews.author: Bill DiPaolo
detailedReviews.text: Gio‚Äôs = undefeated. Eggplant parm, chicken piccata, creamy burrata (gone before the pics), and our MVP wine‚ÄîVilla Pozzi Nero D‚ÄôAvola. North Myrtle‚Äôs best Italian spot, hands down.

detailedReviews.author: Ted Burger
detailedReviews.text: Food was delicious. Don‚Äôt miss the chance to eat at this restaurant Sarah our server was outstanding very attentive and knowledgeable the menu.  Plus she was ‚ÄúHot‚Äù.

detailedReviews.author: marilou cantwell
detailedReviews.text: Delicious food, terrific atmosphere, great wait staff-don‚Äôt miss this one!!!

detailedReviews.author: Chris Ferguson
detailedReviews.text: We ate at Gio‚Äôs for lunch and had the veal meatballs for an app and the marg pizza. The meatballs were good., but I expected more for the price. Pizza was flavorful. The location is great on the edge of Market Commons with lots of shops. All in all, a good meal.

detailedReviews.author: Stephen D
detailedReviews.text:
We‚Äôve been to this restaurant before and had a great experience, even though some of the prices are a bit high for what you get ‚Äî we felt the quality justified it. Unfortunately, our most recent visit for our anniversary was disappointing enough that we won‚Äôt be coming back.

When we arrived, the hostess asked if we had a reservation. We didn‚Äôt, but the place was pretty empty, so we didn‚Äôt think it would be a problem. Still, she looked stressed and told us we‚Äôd get our food faster if we sat at the bar instead of a table. That made little sense, but we agreed to be accommodating.

We placed our orders, but 5‚Äì10 minutes later, our server returned to ask what protein I wanted with my pasta ‚Äî something that should‚Äôve been clarified up front. Assuming it came with the meal, I asked for a chicken cutlet.

After finishing our appetizer, we waited an extremely long time for our entrees. The restaurant was far from busy, so the delay didn‚Äôt make much sense, but we were patient. Then, mid-conversation, a woman (who never introduced herself but seemed to be a manager) abruptly came over to our table. She was blunt and honestly pretty rude ‚Äî she just said, ‚ÄúYour food is coming,‚Äù and added that they‚Äôd been busy with a reserved party. She asked if we needed anything, but it didn‚Äôt feel like a genuine offer, and definitely didn‚Äôt seem like she was offering anything complimentary, so we declined. The whole interaction felt dismissive and unprofessional.

When our meals finally arrived, my wife‚Äôs dish was fine. Mine, on the other hand, was terrible. The pasta was overcooked to the point it was falling apart, the sauce had a burnt flavor, and the ‚Äúchicken cutlet‚Äù turned out to be two dry, grilled pieces of chicken that were hard to chew and not appetizing at all.

I didn‚Äôt want to cause a scene on our anniversary, so I planned to quietly pay and leave. But the waiter noticed I hadn‚Äôt touched my food and asked if something was wrong. I told him honestly. He said they always appreciate feedback and would talk to the chef. Ten minutes later, he returned to tell me the noodles were made fresh that day (as if that explained the overcooking) and then handed me the full check ‚Äî including an extra charge for the chicken I didn‚Äôt want and didn‚Äôt eat.
After seeing how the manager had handled things earlier, I didn‚Äôt feel it was worth pushing further. I paid the bill and we left. Honestly, it felt like being robbed.

We‚Äôve never had an experience like this ‚Äî not just the poor food, but the way the whole situation was handled. What should‚Äôve been a special night ended up being frustrating and disappointing. We won‚Äôt be back.
Response: üòÇ It‚Äôs interesting that this is considered a fine dining establishment, yet the only other couple at the bar was vaping the entire time‚Äîin full view of us and your staff‚Äîwithout a single word said. On top of that, multiple guests were wearing hats, yet you choose to react defensively when someone offers valid criticism about your conduct. Rather than addressing concerns constructively, you dismiss them.

detailedReviews.author: Devon Mazza
detailedReviews.text:
We had an amazing dinner at Gio‚Äôs Italian Restaurant, and the highlight of our night was hands down our waitress, Rose. She was the absolute best waitress we have ever had‚Äîattentive, warm, funny, and incredibly knowledgeable about the menu.

From the moment we sat down, Rose made us feel like we were the most important table in the restaurant. She anticipated everything we needed before we even had to ask, gave spot-on recommendations (definitely try the meatballs & escargot!), and managed to be both professional and genuinely friendly. Her timing was perfect, and her energy made our whole night even more enjoyable.

The food was delicious, the atmosphere was cozy and welcoming, but Rose truly made this experience unforgettable. Gio‚Äôs, you‚Äôve got a gem on your team‚Äîgive that woman a raise!

Highly recommend dining here and asking for Rose if you want a next-level dining experience.

detailedReviews.author: Tyke Tenney
detailedReviews.text: My wife and friends had a delicious meal at Gios. This Italian restaurant has adequate parking in the front and back. The tables are very clean and the decor is beautiful. The servers were attentive and excellent. There is a variety of mostly Italian dishes to choose from  Every meal served to those in our party looked, smelled, and tasted delicious.

detailedReviews.author: Debbie Marascia
detailedReviews.text: Delicious food, very good service. I was thinking I was in for fine dining and some guy was sitting next to us with a baseball hat on. Not good.

detailedReviews.author: Kathleen Goldstrom
detailedReviews.text: Wow!!!  One super experience!!!  The service we received was exceptional (Thank You Rose!!!) and the food was wonderful!!!  I highly recommend the Chicken Marsala with Mushrooms!!!  Excellent offerings of special dishes tonight, and great selections off the regular menu!!!  I appreciated the wine and cocktail menu!!!!  We will return for more!!!!

detailedReviews.author: Emily Vaughan
detailedReviews.text:
Let me tell you! From start to finish my experience was wonderful. When you come, request Rose as your server. She is knowledgeable, sweet, and attentive. I would DIE for Rose. All of our food was amazing. Just come. Seriously. Do it.
XOXO- perfectly unique

detailedReviews.author: Amber Colleran
detailedReviews.text: Rose was an amazing server and the food was outstanding as always. Rose went above and beyond to make sure our dining experience was excellent. Would come again!

detailedReviews.author: Makenzie Prichard
detailedReviews.text: The food at Gios is always amazing, but the service we received from Rose was phenomenal. She was attentive, sweet, and overall one of the best servers I‚Äôve ever had.

customerMoodAnalysis.sentimentSummary: Customers have positive experiences overall. Your 4.4/5 rating from 100 recent reviews shows solid satisfaction with room for growth.

strengthsPerceived: Customers consistently praise the cozy and welcoming atmosphere that makes them feel like family. - social media marketing can showcase this strength

The restaurant is renowned for its excellent and authentic Italian dishes, such as Renato‚Äôs Favorite and lobster ravioli, which are crafted with care and high-quality ingredients. - SEO services can leverage this for better visibility
The service is frequently described as friendly, knowledgeable, and attentive, contributing to a memorable dining experience. - review management can highlight this positive aspect
improvementOpportunities: Inconsistent and poor service experiences, including long wait times and unprofessional staff behavior - Boostly marketing services can improve this
Negative reviews and reputation issues due to service and food quality concerns - review management can address this concern
Dress code inconsistencies and unwelcoming atmosphere - social media marketing can improve this area

positive.author: Diana Westhoff
positive.text: We loved this place. Our last night in Myrtle Beach and we chose this restaurant out of 4 Italian restaurants and was so pleased. Food excellent and service. All was great. Thank you!!

positive.author: Angel Miller
positive.text: Great food and nice servers and hosts! The lobster ravioli was so good and the lavender martini to die for

neutral.author: Debra Jorgensen
neutral.text: Over priced for the amount of food you get. My lettuce was brown on the edges, the bread was hard, and an ant was crawling on the table and onto my grandsons bread.

negative.author: Ron Peeples Jr
negative.text: As a local, not our first time at Gios. At one point I thought this could be some of the best Italian in the area. Sadly, I‚Äôm not sure what happened however something has changed or is headed in the wrong direction. To set the stage, my wife and I sat at the bar around 7pm with only one other patron at the bar and I would say the restaurant was at 50% occupancy at best. It took at least 10 minutes for the bar tender to recognize us. Once recognized some waters were brought over. It took another 10-15 minutes for us to order a drink only after gently reminding the bar tender. Once our food order was placed, the service time was within expectation. Now for the food, and again I thought Gios had some of the best Italian in MB. We ordered the Mediterranean Veal and I the Meatballs and Sausage.  I will speak to the basics of my meal, the sausage and meatballs. The pasta was overcooked and the meatballs were soggy while the sausage overly blackened and squishy. Not what I expected and hopefully this was just a one off experience for the subpar service at the bar and quality of their food. I‚Äôd love to go back and support the restaurant but not at the expense of this recent experience. Hope they can figure out the weak link. I hesitated to write this review but perhaps it won‚Äôt fall on deaf ears.

negative.author: Maria G
negative.text: On a recent visit, we were charged over 11.5% tax on our bill, plus an additional tax for our alcoholic drinks. The next night, we visited another restaurant, paid 8.6% tax and were NOT charged an additional tax for alcoholic drinks!! WTH, Gio's!! Food was good, drinks were very expensive, and we won't be returning.

recommendations.title: Generate More Reviews
recommendations.description: Encourage satisfied customers to leave reviews
